rules.natural: Either passenger1 has a boarding pass for flight101 or passenger2 has a boarding pass for flight101.
Either the passport of passenger1 is verified or the passport of passenger2 is verified.
In the event that the passport of passenger2 is verified, passenger1 is allowed to board flight101.
Whenever the luggage of passenger1 is screened, the luggage of passenger2 is screened.
Either the luggage of passenger1 is screened or passenger1 is allowed to board flight101.
If the luggage of passenger2 is screened, then a prohibited item is found with passenger1.
If a prohibited item is found with passenger2, then a prohibited item is not found with passenger1.
Provided that a prohibited item is found with passenger3, then if the luggage of passenger2 is screened, a prohibited item is found with passenger2.
Whenever passenger2 has a boarding pass for flight101, passenger1 is allowed to board flight101.
Either the metal detector alerts for passenger1 or the metal detector alerts for passenger2.
In the event that the metal detector alerts for passenger2, then if passenger1 has a boarding pass for flight101, passenger1 is allowed to board flight101.
Either the metal detector alerts for passenger3 or, if the metal detector alerts for passenger1, then passenger3 has a boarding pass for flight101.
If additional screening is required for passenger2, then secondary screening is complete for passenger1.
Whenever additional screening is required for passenger2, it is not the case that additional screening is required for passenger3.
In the event that secondary screening is complete for passenger1, then additional screening is required for passenger3.
Provided that secondary screening is complete for passenger2, then passenger1 is allowed to board flight101.
If flight101 boarding has started, then a prohibited item is not found with passenger1.
Whenever flight102 boarding has started, then if the luggage of passenger2 is screened, flight101 boarding starts.
Either a gate agent is available at gate5 or a gate agent is available at gate6.
Provided that a gate agent is available at gate6, then flight102 boarding starts.

In the event that passenger1 holds security clearance level1, then either passenger3 has a boarding pass for flight101 or, if passenger1 has a boarding pass for flight101, then passenger1 is allowed to board flight101.
If passenger2 holds security clearance level1, then passenger3 holds security clearance level1.

If security protocol was activated at terminal_a, then if a security alert was issued at terminal_a, then either a security breach was detected at terminal_a or passenger3 does not hold security clearance level1.
Provided that it is not the case that if the passport of passenger1 is verified, then secondary screening is complete for passenger2, then secondary screening is complete for passenger3.

In the event that it is not the case that if the passport of passenger3 is verified, then if the passport of passenger1 is verified, passenger1 is allowed to board flight101, then passport fraud is detected for passenger1.
If it is not the case that if a gate agent is available at gate5, then flight102 boarding starts, then flight101 is delayed.
Provided that it is not the case that if passenger3 holds security clearance level1, then additional screening is required for passenger1, then additional screening is required for passenger2.
Whenever a prohibited item is not found with passenger3, then a false alarm is triggered at terminal_a.
If a prohibited item is not found with passenger3, then it is not the case that a false alarm is triggered at terminal_a.
In the event that passenger1 is not allowed to board flight101, then passenger2 holds security clearance level1.

(A1 → G).natural: Provided that passenger1 has a boarding pass for flight101, then passenger1 is allowed to board flight101.

(A1 ∨ A2).natural: Either passenger1 has a boarding pass for flight101 or passenger2 has a boarding pass for flight101.

(A10 → A27).natural: Whenever the passport of passenger1 is verified, secondary screening is completed for passenger2.

(A10 → G).natural: If the passport of passenger1 is verified, then passenger1 is allowed to board flight101.

(A10 ∨ A11).natural: Either the passport of passenger1 is verified or the passport of passenger2 is verified.

(A11 → G).natural: In the event that the passport of passenger2 is verified, passenger1 is allowed to board flight101.

(A12 → (A10 → G)).natural: Provided that the passport of passenger3 is verified, then if the passport of passenger1 is verified, passenger1 is allowed to board flight101.

(A14 → A15).natural: Whenever the luggage of passenger1 is screened, the luggage of passenger2 is screened.

(A14 ∨ G).natural: Either the luggage of passenger1 is screened or passenger1 is allowed to board flight101.

(A15 → A16).natural: If the luggage of passenger2 is screened, then a prohibited item is found with passenger1.

(A15 → A17).natural: Provided that the luggage of passenger2 is screened, a prohibited item is found with passenger2.

(A15 → A29).natural: In the event that the luggage of passenger2 is screened, flight101 boarding starts.

(A15 → ¬A16).natural: Whenever the luggage of passenger2 is screened, it is not the case that a prohibited item is found with passenger1.

(A17 → ¬A16).natural: If a prohibited item is found with passenger2, then a prohibited item is not found with passenger1.

(A18 → (A15 → A17)).natural: Provided that a prohibited item is found with passenger3, then if the luggage of passenger2 is screened, a prohibited item is found with passenger2.

(A2 → G).natural: Whenever passenger2 has a boarding pass for flight101, passenger1 is allowed to board flight101.

(A20 → A3).natural: If the metal detector alerts for passenger1, then passenger3 has a boarding pass for flight101.

(A20 ∨ A21).natural: Either the metal detector alerts for passenger1 or the metal detector alerts for passenger2.

(A21 → (A1 → G)).natural: In the event that the metal detector alerts for passenger2, then if passenger1 has a boarding pass for flight101, passenger1 is allowed to board flight101.

(A22 ∨ (A20 → A3)).natural: Either the metal detector alerts for passenger3 or, if the metal detector alerts for passenger1, then passenger3 has a boarding pass for flight101.

(A24 → A25).natural: Provided that additional screening is required for passenger2, then additional screening is required for passenger3.

(A24 → A26).natural: If additional screening is required for passenger2, then secondary screening is complete for passenger1.

(A24 → ¬A25).natural: Whenever additional screening is required for passenger2, it is not the case that additional screening is required for passenger3.

(A26 → A25).natural: In the event that secondary screening is complete for passenger1, then additional screening is required for passenger3.

(A27 → G).natural: Provided that secondary screening is complete for passenger2, then passenger1 is allowed to board flight101.

(A29 → ¬A16).natural: If flight101 boarding has started, then a prohibited item is not found with passenger1.

(A3 ∨ (A1 → G)).natural: Either passenger3 has a boarding pass for flight101 or, if passenger1 has a boarding pass for flight101, then passenger1 is allowed to board flight101.

(A30 → (A15 → A29)).natural: Whenever flight102 boarding has started, then if the luggage of passenger2 is screened, flight101 boarding starts.

(A31 → A30).natural: If a gate agent is available at gate5, then flight102 boarding starts.

(A31 ∨ A32).natural: Either a gate agent is available at gate5 or a gate agent is available at gate6.

(A32 → A30).natural: Provided that a gate agent is available at gate6, then flight102 boarding starts.

(A4 → (A3 ∨ (A1 → G))).natural: In the event that passenger1 holds security clearance level1, then either passenger3 has a boarding pass for flight101 or, if passenger1 has a boarding pass for flight101, then passenger1 is allowed to board flight101.

(A5 → A6).natural: If passenger2 holds security clearance level1, then passenger3 holds security clearance level1.

(A6 → A23).natural: Provided that passenger3 holds security clearance level1, then additional screening is required for passenger1.

(A7 ∨ ¬A6).natural: Either a security breach was detected at terminal_a or it is not the case that passenger3 holds security clearance level1.

(A8 → (A7 ∨ ¬A6)).natural: Whenever a security alert was issued at terminal_a, then either a security breach was detected at terminal_a or passenger3 does not hold security clearance level1.

(¬(A10 → A27) → A28).natural: Provided that it is not the case that if the passport of passenger1 is verified, then secondary screening is complete for passenger2, then secondary screening is complete for passenger3.

(¬(A12 → (A10 → G)) → A13).natural: In the event that it is not the case that if the passport of passenger3 is verified, then if the passport of passenger1 is verified, passenger1 is allowed to board flight101, then passport fraud is detected for passenger1.

(¬(A31 → A30) → A33).natural: If it is not the case that if a gate agent is available at gate5, then flight102 boarding starts, then flight101 is delayed.

(¬(A6 → A23) → A24).natural: Provided that it is not the case that if passenger3 holds security clearance level1, then additional screening is required for passenger1, then additional screening is required for passenger2.

(¬A18 → ¬A19).natural: If a prohibited item is not found with passenger3, then it is not the case that a false alarm is triggered at terminal_a.

(¬G → A5).natural: In the event that passenger1 is not allowed to board flight101, then passenger2 holds security clearance level1.
